intro: Pulicaria schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat. Pulicaria schimperi is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
